intro: Schizomussaenda, commonly known as the African butter tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy yellow or orange flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are often used in traditional medicine and culinary practices. Schizomussaenda species are typically shrubs or small trees, often growing in moist, forested areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
